description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/3755660409 at Sat Feb 11 17:48:37 UTC 2023

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: internal-api Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: internal-api Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: internal-api Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.title: rails_request SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The number of requests meeting their duration target based on the urgency
of the endpoint. By default, a request should take no more than 1s. But
this can be adjusted by endpoint.

Read more about this in the [documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/application_slis/rails_request_apdex.html).



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Rails logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.status,json.method,json.meta.caller_id,json.meta.feature_category,json.path,json.request_urgency,json.duration_s,json.target_duration_s),filters:!((meta:(key:json.subcomponent,negate:!t,params:graphql_json,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.subcomponent:(query:graphql_json,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),index:'7092c4e2-4eb5-46f2-8305-a7da2edad090')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Rails slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.status,json.method,json.meta.caller_id,json.meta.feature_category,json.path,json.request_urgency,json.duration_s,json.target_duration_s),filters:!((meta:(key:json.subcomponent,negate:!t,params:graphql_json,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.subcomponent:(query:graphql_json,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.target_duration_s,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.target_duration_s))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.duration_s,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.duration_s))),!((meta:(key:query,type:custom,value:'{"bool":+{"minimum_should_match":+1,+"should":+[{"script":+{"script":+{"source":+"doc[!'json.duration_s!'].value+>+doc[!'json.target_duration_s!'].value"}}}]}}'),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((script:(script:(source:'doc[!'json.duration_s!'].value+>+doc[!'json.target_duration_s!'].value'))))))))),index:'7092c4e2-4eb5-46f2-8305-a7da2edad090',sort:!(!(json.duration_s,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )

    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="workhorse",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="workhorse",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="internal-api"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: workhorse SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most web requests that pass through workhorse, monitored via the HTTP interface.
Excludes health, readiness and liveness requests. Some known slow requests, such as HTTP uploads,
are excluded from the apdex score.



### Observability Tools

* [Google Stackdriver Continuous Profiling](https://console.cloud.google.com/profiler;timespan=4h/workhorse-api;type=CPU/cpu?project=gitlab-production)
* [üêû Sentry Releases: gitlab/gitlab-workhorse-gitlabcom](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlab-workhorse-gitlabcom/releases?environment=${environment})
* [üêû Sentry issues](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlab-workhorse-gitlabcom/issues?environment=${environment})
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.duration_ms,params:(gte:10000),type:range),query:(range:(json.duration_ms:(gte:10000))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4',sort:!(!(json.duration_ms,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.status,params:(gte:500),type:range),query:(range:(json.status:(gte:500))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.status,params:(gte:500),type:range),query:(range:(json.status:(gte:500))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse sum latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.remote_ip.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.duration_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.remote_ip.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.duration_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.duration_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Workhorse percentile latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'internal-api',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'internal-api',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.remote_ip.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderAgg:(enabled:!t,id:'3-orderAgg',params:(field:json.duration_ms),schema:orderAgg,type:sum),orderBy:custom,otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.duration_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for rails_request Latency - per endpoint_id

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for rails_request Latency - per feature_category

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for rails_request Latency - per request_urgency

targets.expr:
histogram_quantile(
  0.900000,
  sum by (le) (
    rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~"gitlab-workhorse-api|gitlab-workhorse", type="internal-api", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
  )
)
 > 0

sum by () (
  rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_requests_total{job=~"gitlab-workhorse-api|gitlab-workhorse", type="internal-api", code=~"^5.*", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
)
 > 0

histogram_quantile(
  0.900000,
  sum by (le,region) (
    rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job=~"gitlab-workhorse-api|gitlab-workhorse", type="internal-api", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$", env="$environment",environment="$environment",region!="",stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
  )
)
 > 0

panels.description: Network utilization
panels.title: internal-api Deployment: Network IO

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.
panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in the node pool for
a service fleet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total:labeled{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_cpu component saturation: Average Node Pool CPU Utilization

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="internal-api"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_max_nodes component saturation: Kube Pool Max Node Limit

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
